Just Enough Computer Fun

I've never been a true gamer (I tried, but one of my guilty pleasures is buying tons of games and finishing none). Out of nowhere, my daughter started asking me to build her games (who even told her that was a thing?!). The clueless part of me just said, 'Sure!' and that's how this journey began. Somehow, creating these simple games for her is way more fulfilling than playing games myself.

Solar System Simulation

(a realistic, calm space travel)

A realistic 3D solar system simulation with accurate physics and time control. Perfect for explaining space to kids or just zoning out.
Read more
Sudoku

(for small geniuses)

A colorful, child-friendly Sudoku game with 3 difficulty levels, fun sounds, and a confetti reward.
Read more
CantoPlay

(learn Cantonese on canvas)

A calm, canvas-based Cantonese practice game with flashcards, a quiz, and a gentle mini-game - built for my daughter before our HK trip.
Read more
Number Playground

(my one-evening tribute to Numberblocks)

A one-evening project to create an interactive number playground for a three-year-old, inspired by Numberblocks.
Read more
Toddler Types!

(a super-chill first typing game)

A simple, no-pressure typing game for young children, built with plain HTML/CSS/JS to practice letter and number recognition.
Read more
LeseSpaß (Reading Fun)

(a German reading game)

A simple, no-pressure reading game for young children, built with plain HTML/CSS/JS to practice phonics and sight words recognition.
Read more
